title: e-Learning Design Strategies for Science Learning: Utilizing Mixed Methods Research and Focus Group Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational technology skills and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: A program to strengthen science field e-learning design competencies in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, focusing on real Learning Management System (LMS) design projects.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze e-learning design requirements by applying mixed research methods (qualitative and quantitative).
Learners can design e-learning content for science learning through focus group discussions (involving teachers, learning specialists, and domain experts).
Learners can evaluate e-learning prototypes using the USE questionnaire (Usefulness, Ease of Use, Ease of Learning, Satisfaction).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
